title.raw: 卷四 文帝紀 Volume 4: Annals of Emperor Wen

sentences.zh: 孝文皇帝，高祖中子也，母曰薄姬。
高祖十一年，誅陳豨，定代地，立為代王，都中都。
十七年秋，高后崩，諸呂謀為亂，欲危劉氏。
丞相陳平、太尉周勃、朱虛侯劉章等共誅之，謀立代王。
語在高后紀、高五王傳。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen was Gaozu's middle son, born to Lady Bo. In the eleventh year of Gaozu's reign, after executing Chen Xi and pacifying the Dai territories, he was enfeoffed as King of Dai with his capital at Zhongdu. In autumn of the seventeenth year, Empress Gao passed away. The various members of the Lü clan plotted rebellion and sought to endanger the Liu family. Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, and Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang joined forces to execute them and plotted to establish the King of Dai on the throne. The account is in the Annals of Empress Gao and the Biographies of the Five Kings of Gao.

sentences.zh: 大臣遂使人迎代王。
郎中令張武等議，皆曰：「漢大臣皆故高帝時將，習兵事，多謀詐，其屬意非止此 也，特畏高帝、呂太后威耳。
今已誅諸呂，新喋血京師，以迎大王為名，實不可信。
願稱疾無往，以觀其變。」
中尉宋昌進曰：「群臣之議皆非也。
夫秦失其政，豪 傑並起，人人自以為得之者以萬數，然卒踐天子位者，劉氏也，天下絕望，一矣。
高帝王子弟，地犬牙相制，所謂盤石之宗也，天下服其彊，二矣。
漢興，除秦煩 苛，約法令，施德惠，人人自安，難動搖，三矣。
夫以呂太后之嚴，立諸呂為三王，擅權專制，然而太尉以一節入北軍，一呼士皆袒左，為劉氏，畔諸呂，卒以滅 之。
此乃天授，非人力也。
今大臣雖欲為變，百姓弗為使，其黨寧能專一邪？
內有朱虛、東牟之親，外畏吳、楚、淮南、琅邪、齊、代之彊。
方今高帝子獨淮南王與 大王，大王又長，賢聖仁孝，聞於天下，故大臣因天下之心而欲迎立大王，大王勿疑也。」
代王報太后，計猶豫未定。
卜之，兆得大橫。
占曰：「大橫庚庚，余為天 王，夏啟以光。」
代王曰：「寡人固已為王，又何王乎？」
卜人曰：「所謂天王者，乃天子也。」
於是代王乃遣太后弟薄昭見太尉勃，勃等具言所以迎立王者。
昭還 報曰：「信矣，無可疑者。」
代王笑謂宋昌曰：「果如公言。」
乃令宋昌驂乘，張武等六人乘六乘傳詣長安。
至高陵止，而使宋昌先之長安觀變。

translations.literal: The ministers then dispatched envoys to welcome the King of Dai. Palace Attendant Commander Zhang Wu and others discussed the matter and all declared: 'The Han ministers are all veteran generals from Emperor Gao's time, experienced in military affairs and skilled in intrigue. Their ambitions extend beyond this—they were merely intimidated by the authority of Emperor Gao and Empress Lü.' Now that the Lü clan has been executed and blood still stains the capital streets, they come under the pretense of welcoming Your Majesty, but their intentions cannot be trusted. I advise feigning illness and not going, so we may observe how events develop.' Guard Commander Song Chang stepped forward and said: 'All the ministers' discussions are mistaken.' When Qin lost its governance, the regional lords and heroes rose up together. The Han king was the first to gain the empire because of his generosity, benevolence, love of ritual, and willingness to accept remonstrance without resentment. Thus the hearts of the people turned to him. Now the empire has just been pacified. Although there are great meritorious ministers, they are distant from the people's hearts. All believe they cannot match the generous benevolence and frugal modesty of Emperor Xiaohui, and that even with the strictness of Empress Lü, they could not approach the virtue of Emperor Wen. Now even if the ministers wished to rebel, the common people would not follow them. Could their faction possibly unite as one? The common people are the foundation of the regional lords. When sending envoys with commands throughout the realm, there should be no seizing or interference. Now the ministers, in punishing the Lü clan's crimes, have executed entire clans and caused arrows to fly wildly. When heaven's punishment is applied, there must be injustice involved. Moreover, the imperial carriage and great procession remain at the border regions. I wish to offer my foolish loyalty in performing my duties. If you do not follow this advice, I request to die in remonstrance before your corpse. Thereupon Zhang Wu and the others all declared: 'The chancellor's proposal cannot be used.' They then obeyed the imperial command and went with Feng Jing, uncle of the King of Huainan, to the Dai residence. By imperial command, Song Chang was summoned to ride in the carriage, while Zhang Wu and five others followed by relay post. Upon reaching Chang'an, the assembled ministers greeted them in their ranks. When Qin lost its governance, heroes arose together. Each person considered themselves capable of gaining the throne, numbering in the tens of thousands. Yet in the end, it was the Liu clan who ascended the imperial throne. The realm had despaired—this was the first reason. Emperor Gao's sons and younger brothers held territories that interlocked like dog's teeth, mutually restraining each other. This was called a lineage as solid as rock. The realm submitted to its strength—this was the second reason. When Han arose, it eliminated Qin's troublesome harshness, simplified the laws and commands, and extended benevolent favor. Each person felt secure and was difficult to shake—this was the third reason. Now the power of the realm lies with Your Majesty. No one can speak against it. Even with the dignity of an Empress Dowager, if she were to divide territories and enfeoff them, they would still be taken away. I hope Your Majesty will not fear them. Quickly lead troops to the Dai residence and take command of the Huaiyin Marquis's forces to secure the capital. Even if there is unrest, I wish to die together with the ministers. Thereupon Emperor Wen that very night drove into Weiyang Palace and met with the Empress Dowager, fully explaining the situation. Thereupon he issued an edict to Chancellor Chen Ping and Grand Commandant Zhou Bo: 'Now that I have ascended the imperial throne, what I value most in the realm is that I have no doubts regarding the Chancellor and Grand Commandant.' If there are any matters that do not go as intended, I rely on the Chancellor and Grand Commandant to handle them.'

sentences.zh: 昌至渭橋，丞相已下皆迎。
昌還報，代王乃進至渭橋。
群臣拜謁稱臣，代王下拜。
太尉勃進曰：「願請間。」
宋昌曰：「所言公，公言之；
所言私，王者無私。」
太尉勃乃跪上天子璽。
代王謝曰：「至邸而議之。」

translations.literal: He then appointed Song Chang as Guard General, commanding the northern and southern armies, and overseeing the keys to the army gates. Zhang Wu was appointed Palace Attendant Commander to manage affairs within the palace. He then paid respects at the Gao Temple and assumed the imperial position. In the first year of Emperor Wen, tenth month, geng-xu day, the emperor ascended the throne. He granted amnesty to the realm and changed the reign title. In the eleventh month, gui-you day, an edict declared: 'To establish an enterprise for ten thousand generations, nothing compares to appointing worthy and good officials to assist oneself, and appointing a Palace Attendant Commander to pick up omissions.' He then established the position of Courtier Commander. In the twelfth month, ren-yin day, an edict declared: 'Law is the correct way of governance. It is what prohibits violence and guides good people.'

sentences.zh: 十二月，立趙幽王子遂為趙王，徙琅邪王澤為燕王。
呂氏所奪齊楚地皆歸之。
盡除收帑相坐律令。

translations.literal: Now the laws have varying depths and do not achieve fairness. The people sometimes profit by narrowly avoiding punishment while falling into crime. Abolish the laws commanding collective punishment for confiscating property and related matters.' In spring, first month, the officials requested the emperor to inspect agriculture and sericulture. The emperor said: 'I personally plow the fields, and the empress personally tends the silkworms, to provide grain offerings and sacrificial foods for the ancestral temple. We do not engage in extravagant displays, but serve as parents to the people by working diligently ourselves.'

sentences.zh: 正月，有司請蚤建太子，所以尊宗廟也。
詔曰：「朕既不德，上帝神明未歆饗也，天下人民未有轺志。
今 縱不能博求天下賢聖有德之人而嬗天下焉，而曰豫建太子，是重吾不德也。
謂天下何？
其安之。」
有司曰：「豫建太子，所以重宗廟社稷，不忘天下也。」
上曰： 「楚王，季父也，春秋高，閱天下之義理多矣，明於國家之體。
吳王於朕，兄也；
淮南王，弟也：皆秉德以陪朕，豈為不豫哉！
諸侯王宗室昆弟有功臣，多賢及有德 義者，若舉有德以陪朕之不能終，是社稷之靈，天下之福也。
今不選舉焉，而曰必子，人其以朕為忘賢有德者而專於子，非所以憂天下也。
朕甚不取。」
有司固請 曰：「古者殷周有國，治安皆且千歲，有天下者莫長焉，用此道也。
立嗣必子，所從來遠矣。
高帝始平天下，建諸侯，為帝者太祖。
諸侯王列侯始受國者亦皆為其國 祖。
子孫繼嗣，世世不絕，天下之大義也。
故高帝設之以撫海內。
今釋宜建而更選於諸侯宗室，非高帝之志也。
更議不宜。
子啟最長，敦厚慈仁，請建以為太子。」
上乃許之。
因賜天下民當為父後者爵一級。
封將軍薄昭為軹侯。

translations.literal: The empress, within her curtains, cuts and sews ritual garments. She personally cares for the elderly and visits widows and widowers, setting an example for the realm. This is not sufficient to demonstrate to the world how parents should treat their children and grandchildren.' He completely abolished the laws and commands regarding collective punishment for confiscating property. In summer, fourth month, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the sixth month, amnesty was granted to the realm. In autumn, ninth month, amnesty was granted to the realm. In the second year, tenth month, Chancellor Chen Ping passed away. An edict declared: 'I have heard that in ancient times, the regional lords established over a thousand states, each guarding their territory. They contributed tribute at the proper times, the people were not wearied, superiors and inferiors lived in harmony. I greatly approve of this.' Now the marquises mostly reside in Chang'an. Their fiefs are distant, and the officials and soldiers suffer from the costs of transporting supplies. Moreover, the marquises have no way to instruct their people.' Order the marquises to return to their countries. For those retained by official position or imperial command, send their heirs.' On the last day of the eleventh month, there was a solar eclipse. An edict declared: 'I have heard that Heaven gives birth to the people and establishes rulers to nurture and govern them.' If the ruler lacks virtue and governance is uneven, Heaven shows disasters to warn of poor governance.' Now on the last day of the eleventh month, there was a solar eclipse. I am greatly fearful.' Order all officials and people of the realm to consider the blame for this solar eclipse to rest on me alone.' Grant great amnesty to the realm.' In spring, first month, ding-hai day, an edict declared: 'Agriculture is the great foundation of the realm, that upon which the people depend for life. Yet some people neglect this foundation and pursue secondary occupations, so life is not fulfilled.' I urge agricultural affairs and personally plow to encourage the people.' This year I will personally plow the ritual field. Regional kings, dukes, marquises who have newly received their fiefs, those with merit and virtue, generals and sons of generals below the rank of general, illegitimate sons, officials of 2000 shi, imperial clansmen and sons of kings, sons of dukes and ministers must not walk in the imperial roadways.' In summer, fourth month, wu-xu day, an edict declared: 'I have obtained protection of the ancestral temple. With my insignificant person entrusted above the scholars, people, lords, and kings, if the realm is well governed then I am honored; if chaotic then I am to blame.' Now the realm is greatly at peace, the people harmonious and happy—this is all due to my good fortune.' Yet my officials may be unclear, laws harsh and officials cruel. Among resentful people and sorrowful officials, this is hardly the way of governance.' Therefore I wish to reform the laws, carefully select officials, and lighten punishments, so that fathers and sons, brothers and relatives may remain together for a long time without separation.' The officials firmly requested: 'In ancient times, Yin and Zhou possessed their states. Their peaceful governance lasted nearly a thousand years each. None who possessed the realm lasted longer than this. They used this way.' Establishing an heir must be a son—this principle comes from long ago.'

sentences.zh: 三月，有司請立皇后。
皇太后曰：「立太子母竇氏為皇后。」

translations.literal: The emperor said: 'Not so.' From ancient times until now, the way of establishing heirs has not necessarily required the eldest son.'

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「方春和時，草木群生之物皆有以自樂，而吾百姓鰥寡孤獨窮困之人或阽於死亡，而莫之省憂。
為 民父母將何如？
其議所以振貸之。」
又曰：「老者非帛不煖，非肉不飽。
今歲首，不時使人存問長老，又無布帛酒肉之賜，將何以佐天下子孫孝養其親？
今聞吏稟當 受鬻者，或以陳粟，豈稱養老之意哉！
具為令。」
有司請令縣道，年八十已上，賜米人月一石，肉二十斤，酒五斗。
其九十已上，又賜帛人二疋，絮三斤。
賜物及當 稟鬻米者，長吏閱視，丞若尉致。
不滿九十，嗇夫、令史致。
二千石遣都吏循行，不稱者督之。
刑者及有罪耐以上，不用此令。

translations.literal: What I wish to establish is a capable person to continue the ancestral temple sacrifices.' Therefore he dismissed the discussion and did not change it. In summer, fifth month, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the sixth month, he sent carriages and horses to welcome the Queen Mother from Dai. In winter, tenth month, he arranged marriages between the imperial clan and the Lü clan. In the third year, winter, tenth month, he arranged marriages between the imperial clan and the Lü clan. In summer, fourth month, on the wu-chen last day, there was a solar eclipse. He granted amnesty to the realm. In autumn, King of Hengshan passed away. In the fourth year, summer, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the fifth year, spring, first month, he again issued an edict to the Chancellor, Grand Commandant, and Imperial Secretary: 'I have heard that the way to govern a country begins with enriching the people; the key to enriching the people lies in frugality.' What produces life is very little, while what wastes it is very much. The realm is depleted, the people impoverished and suffering.' As parents to the people, we should nurture life without harming their livelihood.'

sentences.zh: 四月，齊楚地震，二十九山同日崩，大水潰出。

translations.literal: Now for a farming family of five mouths, those serving in labor are no fewer than two, those able to plow no more than 100 mu. The harvest from 100 mu is no more than 100 shi.'

sentences.zh: 六月，令郡國無來獻。
施惠天下，諸侯四夷遠近驩洽。
乃脩代來功。
詔曰：「方大臣誅諸呂迎朕，朕狐 疑，皆止朕，唯中尉宋昌勸朕，朕已得保宗廟。
已尊昌為衛將軍，其封昌為壯武侯。
諸從朕六人，官皆至九卿。」
又曰：「列侯從高帝入蜀漢者六十八人益邑各三百 戶。
吏二千石以上從高帝潁川守尊等十人食邑六百戶，淮陽守申屠嘉等十人五百戶，衛尉足等十人四百戶。」
封淮南王舅趙兼為周陽侯，齊王舅駟鈞為靖郭侯，故常 山丞相蔡兼為樊侯。

translations.literal: Spring plowing, summer weeding, autumn harvesting, winter storing; cutting firewood, managing official business, providing labor service. In spring cannot avoid wind and dust, summer cannot avoid heat, autumn cannot avoid rain, winter cannot avoid cold.' Four mouths year after year face the fields under heaven, to pay taxes and grain, three hundred cash.' I therefore say the farmer's hardship reaches the extreme.' Now I hear that what people lavish on are carriages, horses, clothing, furs, and palaces—all exceeding frugality. What they lack are fields, houses, utensils, and people.' In ancient times governing the realm, labor service was little and people many. Now governing the realm, labor service is much and people few.' I have heard that when people are poor, wickedness arises; when rich, benevolence and righteousness flourish.' There is a saying: 'The source of extravagance makes superiors and inferiors all poor.'' I have a foolish plan. I hope Your Majesty will fortunately listen to its essentials.' Your Majesty is still young and has just ascended the throne. You should personally practice frugality to manifest the virtue of simplicity.'

sentences.zh: 十一月癸卯晦，日有食之。
詔曰：「朕聞之，天生民，為之置君以養治之。
人主不德，布政不均，則天示 之災以戒不治。
乃十一月晦，日有食之，適見于天，災孰大焉！
朕獲保宗廟，以微眇之身託于士民君王之上，天下治亂，在予一人，唯二三執政猶吾股肱也。
朕下不 能治育群生，上以累三光之明，其不德大矣。
令至，其悉思朕之過失，及知見之所不及，饨以啟告朕。
及舉賢良方正能直言極諫者，以匡朕之不逮。
因各敕以職任， 務省繇費以便民。
朕既不能遠德，故贳然念外人之有非，是以設備未息。
今縱不能罷邊屯戍，又飭兵厚衛，其罷衛將軍軍。
太僕見馬遺財足，餘皆以給傳置。」

translations.literal: In the palace, during leisure moments, clothing that fits the body, silk and linen decorations—these are not what they should have.' Using the realm's public resources for this is not the principle of frugality.' Should Your Majesty alone not shed tears?' Thereupon the emperor was moved and enlightened. His clothing did not change color, his carriage wheels were not replaced. During leisure moments, he used only what was necessary.' Until now, the realm considers frugality beautiful. Families are provided for, people sufficient. Though without the name of frugality, they have the reality of frugality.' Though not yet reaching antiquity, it approaches it.' In summer, fourth month, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the fifth month, the Grand Storehouse Official of Qi, Chunyu Yi, committed a crime and was to be punished. The imperial prison arrested and confined him in Chang'an. His young daughter Tiying memorialized: 'My father serves as an official. All in Qi praise his integrity and fairness.' Now he sits under the law and should be punished. I grieve that the dead cannot be revived, and the mutilated cannot be restored. Though one wishes to reform and renew oneself, there is no path.' I wish to enter as an official slave to redeem my father's punishment, allowing him to renew himself.' The memorial reached the emperor, who was saddened by it. An edict declared: 'I have heard that in the time of Yu Shun, they painted clothing and caps, made distinctive garments, as a mark of disgrace yet the people did not offend. What perfect governance!'

sentences.zh: 春正月丁亥，詔曰：「夫農，天下之本也，其開藉田，朕親率耕，以給宗廟粢盛。
民謫作縣官及貸種食未入、入未備者，皆赦之。」

translations.literal: Now the laws have three mutilating punishments, yet wickedness does not cease. Where does the blame lie?' The emperor said: 'I have heard that in ancient times, they honored the fundamentals and promoted culture, guiding the people with ritual and restraining them with law.'

sentences.zh: 三月，有司請立皇子為諸侯王。
詔曰：「前趙幽王幽死，朕甚憐之，已立其太子遂為趙王。
遂弟辟彊及齊悼惠王子朱虛侯章、東牟侯興居有功，可王。」
乃遂立辟彊為河間王，章為城陽王，興居為濟北王。
因立皇子武為代王，參為太原王，揖為梁王。

translations.literal: Now when people violate laws and incur punishment, some die and die, others are injured and remain injured, for life and remain for life.' Those who violate laws and incur punishment, and wicked evil ones who cannot be reformed by sincerity and revived—all do not punish with mutilation.' Those whose bodies are not yet dead, and those whose injuries have not yet healed—all do not punish with mutilation.' Thereupon he issued an edict: 'Imperial command to the Imperial Secretary: The three mutilating punishments, yet wickedness does not cease. The blame rests on my person.' People cannot exhaust their strength, establish merit to redeem themselves.'

sentences.zh: 五月，詔曰：「古之治天下，朝有進善之旌，誹謗之木，所以通治道而來諫者也。
今法有誹謗訞言之罪， 是使眾臣不敢盡情，而上無由聞過失也。
將何以來遠方之賢良？
其除之。
民或祝詛上，以相約而後相謾，吏以為大逆，其有他言，吏又以為誹謗。
此細民之愚，無知 抵死，朕甚不取。
自今以來，有犯此者勿聽治。」

translations.literal: Now all who receive ancient mutilating punishments, and those sentenced to death by beheading, all complete as city wall pounding.' The emperor requested: 'I greatly pity them.' Abolish this law.'' In the sixth month, Chancellor Zhang Cang was dismissed. Feng Jing was appointed Chancellor. In the twelfth month, the Yellow River breached in Dongjun. In the sixth month, he granted amnesty to the realm.

sentences.zh: 九月，初與郡守為銅虎符、竹使符。

translations.literal: In the seventh month, King Chang of Huainan killed the Marquis of Piyang and was guilty of execution in the marketplace.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「農，天下之大本也，民所恃以生也，而民或不務本而事末，故生不遂。
朕憂其然，故今茲親率群臣農以勸之。
其賜天下民今年田租之半。」

translations.literal: By imperial command he was pardoned and relocated to Shujun. In the sixth year, winter, tenth month, someone memorialized accusing King Wu of Chu of plotting rebellion. The emperor asked the ministers about it. All said: 'Do not investigate thoroughly, lest it cause calamity.''

sentences.zh: 三年冬十月丁酉晦，日有食之。
十一月丁卯晦，日有蝕之。

translations.literal: The emperor said: 'I especially considered it was only that the officials had not yet received the matter. Now the state has important ministers with nothing to fear or avoid. I greatly worry about this.' Now I can send someone to serve as my envoy to inspect it, without suspicion.''

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「前日詔遣列侯之國，辭未行。
丞相朕之所重，其為遂率列侯之國。」
遂免丞相勃，遣就國。
十二月，太尉潁陰侯灌嬰為丞相。
罷太尉官，屬丞相。

translations.literal: He then sent the Imperial Kinsman Zheng to instruct the crown prince, named him Zheng. In the sixth month, the King of Chu came to court. In the seventh month, the crown prince was capped. In the ninth month, the Xiongnu entered Shangjun. He dispatched General Chai Wu to exit Weihe and rescue Shangjun.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，城陽王章薨。
淮南王長殺辟陽侯審食其。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, spring, King Jia of Yan passed away. In summer, the empress passed away.

sentences.zh: 五月，匈奴入居北地、河南為寇。
上幸甘泉，遣丞相灌嬰擊匈奴，匈奴去。
發中尉材官屬衛將軍，軍長安。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Zhu Xu Marquis Zhu Xu Hou Zhang, son of King Daohui of Qi, passed away. In the eleventh year, spring, first month, the Empress Dowager passed away. In summer, fifth month, an edict declared: 'I have heard that in ancient times, when dispatching generals to campaign and raising troops, they personally performed suburban sacrifices to send them off, expressing sincerity to Heaven.'

sentences.zh: 上自甘泉之高奴，因幸太原，見故群臣，皆賜之。

Those attending mourning, each morning and evening make fifteen cries of lamentation, then the ritual is complete and ends.' Except for morning and evening at the time of attendance, prohibit unauthorized crying.' After burial, wear great red for fifteen days, small red for fourteen days, fine mourning for seven days, then remove mourning clothes.' Those not in the command, all follow this command proportionally.' Announce to the realm, no prohibition.' In the thirty-fourth year, winter, tenth month, yi-si day, the emperor collapsed in Weiyang Palace. The bequeathed edict said: 'I have heard that all things in the realm that sprout and grow inevitably die.' Death is the principle of Heaven and Earth, the natural course of things.' How can there be excessive grief!' In the present time, the world all values life and hates death, lavish burials to ruin livelihoods, heavy mourning to harm life,' I greatly disapprove.' Also announce to the realm, let them know my intention.'

sentences.zh: 贊曰：孝文皇帝即位二十三年，宮室苑囿車騎服御無所增益。
有不便，輒弛以利民。
嘗欲作露臺，召匠計 之，直百金。
上曰：「百金，中人十家之產也。
吾奉先帝宮室，常恐羞之，何以臺為！」
身衣弋綈，所幸慎夫人衣不曳地，帷帳無文繡，以示敦朴，為天下先。
治霸 陵，皆瓦器，不得以金銀銅錫為飾，因其山，不起墳。
南越尉佗自立為帝，召貴佗兄弟，以德懷之，佗遂稱臣。
與匈奴結和親，後而背約入盜，令邊備守，不發兵深 入，恐煩百姓。
吳王詐病不朝，賜以几杖。
群臣袁盎等諫說雖切，常假借納用焉。
張武等受賂金錢，覺，更加賞賜，以媿其心。
專務以德化民，是以海內殷富，興於 禮義，斷獄數百，幾致刑措。
嗚呼，仁哉！

Granted him a table and staff.' The ministers Yuan Ang and others' remonstrance and persuasion, though earnest, were often borrowed and accepted.' Zhang Wu and others received bribes of gold and money. When discovered, he additionally rewarded them to shame their hearts.' Specially devoted to transforming the people with virtue, therefore within the seas prosperous and rich, flourishing in ritual and righteousness, judging cases in the hundreds, nearly reaching the point where punishments were set aside.'
